result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle B. Herrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for early discharge after 1 year, if all terms complete, upon Agent's written petition to the Court.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present. 
Defendant shall not associate with individuals using or in possession of illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy. 
Defendant shall notify Agent within 48 hours of any new or changing prescriptions and medical visits. 
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

C: Defendant, DOC
C: Defendant, DOC
Elements

Defendant Danielle B. Herrick in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant ordered this morning is quashed by the Court. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest pleas to counts 1, 2 & 4. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of counts 1, 2 & 4. 
Counts 3, 5 & 6 are dismissed and read in. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 18 months probation on each count, concurrent. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Ch. 961
- not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present 
- not associated with individuals using or in possession of illegal substances, paraphernalia or contraband as defined in Ch. 961 
- obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 48 hours of any new or changing prescriptions and medical visits 
- eligible for early discharge if all terms complete after 1 year, upon Agent's petition to the Court 
Advised of appeal rights.
